1.content:
“.... And with your help, Blackridge Inc. can help to lead Metropolis into the future, a future built on clean, sustainable energy for the entire city. Thank you.”


Jake Blackridge left the stage as the applause from the sea of investors showered him with applause. It was the annual Blackridge Inc. investors meeting, and Jake had just finished announcing the company’s plan to expand from just being the city’s tech giant to providing forms of clean, alternative energy for all of Metropolis. Jake’s wife, Courtney, waited for him as he walked through the wings of the stage, greeting her husband with a kiss on the cheek while handing him his phone. “Great stuff out there, as always. CNBC is already projecting company stock to soar tomorrow morning at the opening bell.” Jake smirked a little bit to himself, pleased to hear the news. With Metropolis’ recent peace, he’d been able to focus more and more on building the company, to the point where he’d already become the 4th richest person alive, despite the fact that he was only twenty-three years of age.

Metropolis’ villain activity had fallen drastically over the past three years, as improvements to prison infrastructure, along with improvements in crime prevention by the city’s police force, had nearly lowered Metropolis’ crime rate to 0%. Birdboy and Catgirl had locked up the rest of the villains, and finally, Metropolis was able to breathe clean and easy. The city was finally reaching its full potential, and it had Jake Blackridge to thank... more than most civilians knew, of course.


Jake and Courtney walked through the back of the convention center where the meeting was being hosted, as Courtney, still his secretary after all the time, read off his appointments to him. “We have the art exhibit opening tonight at eight PM, you’re having Coffee with Beth at three, and...” Courtney took pause. There was something written on her virtual calendar that wasn’t there this morning. “... and you have a meeting with your “other wife”... right now.”


Before Jake could even blink, himself and Courtney were transported seamlessly into Jake’s private office, where PuppetMistress, Jake’s guardian angel, and wife in death was waiting, sitting back in his chair with her feet up on his desk. “Hi, hun.” She offered Jake a small wave, and a small smile to go with it. Jake was used to her powers by now, so he wasn’t shocked by the teleportation, even though he did see it as a bit of an inconvenience at the very moment. Him and Courtney both took two of the other seats in the office. “Puppet...” Jake cleared his throat a bit. “This is certainly unexpected... it’s been-...” “Three years.” PuppetMistress finished his sentence for him, and sat up straight. “Three years of peace, and prosperity, where I’ve just been able to sit around and get some reading done, while not having to worry about saving your skin every five minutes or so...” Puppet took a deep breath, clearly concerned and worried about what she was about to share. “And I’m sad to say that it’s coming to an end.”

Jake and Courtney shared a look, before raising their eyebrows and leaning in closer. “What’re you talking about? If one of the villains had gotten out of prison, we would know about it...” PuppetMistress shook her head. “I’m referring to the villains that can’t be held in any sort of physical prison. The Immortals. Stinkromancer. Froststench. Ashley Bilefoot. Lady Akushu. Countess Vashnara. And the Deathknight, Paladria. They’ve broken through the inter-dimensional prison I had sealed them in, and in the process, created a rift to another universe- one in which I did not create.”

Jake cocked his head. “I thought you made everything.” Puppet smirked a bit, and reached out, wanting to stroke Jake’s face, but her arms simply weren’t long enough. “Oh, my Jake. Somehow, so bright, yet so simple at the same time. You have no idea how much I’ve missed you.” Courtney’s glare told PuppetMistress to get on with it. PuppetMistress retracted her hand and continued.

“... And while they were still imprisoned by me, I caught wind of what they were planning to do.”

PuppetMistress created a projection with her hand on the wall, showing five rings, each with a different colored gemstone: Yellow, Green, Red, Blue, And Black. “The rings you see here are known collectively as the Keys of the Cleansed. The five of them being separated from one another at all times acts as a sort of lock. See, back at the very beginning of the creation of this universe, things got... a little out of control...”

PuppetMistress’ words gave Jake pause. “Wait... there are others like you?” Puppet nodded her head.

“I was not the only entity present in its creation. There exist beings more powerful than I. There was one known as The Filthmother, a creature so disgusting, so vile, I had no choice but to lock her away. I created the five rings as a locking mechanism, a way to ensure she remained imprisoned. Now, the Immortals want to join the stones together and release her, so that she may destroy this, and all other surrounding universes, subjecting them all to her namesake filth...”

Courtney could feel a lump forming in her throat. “Alright.. So... what do you want us to do about this whole thing? Jake isn’t Birdboy anymore. And I’m just his secretary for Christ sakes.”

“If Filthmother gets free, there’s nothing that I, or anybody else can do to stop her.” PuppetMistress quipped back. “That’s why I need you to go and get me those rings, Jake.”

Jake’s eyebrow furrowed at that request. “Wait... So... you want me to prevent those five rings from being joined together... by joining the five rings together?”

PuppetMistress shook her head. “No, no. As long as we don’t touch the actual gems to each other, they’re fine. I’m going to destroy them.”

Jake nodded hesitantly, but there was still something fishy about this whole plan. “Alright... continue...”

“The city needs Birdboy to come out of retirement. It doesn’t know it, yet... but once the Immortals really start their hunt, things will get worse for this city than they ever were before...”

Jake takes a deep breath, and he feels Courtney’s hand latch onto his. It was clear all of this made her nervous as well, the idea that Jake would have to don the suit again. She had thought they’d gotten away from that life. Jake swallowed his nerves and looked back up at PuppetMistress. “Alright... maybe I can gather these rings up without too much trouble. Then you can destroy them, lock the Immortals away again, seal up that rift, and we all go on with our lives... so... where are the rings?”

PuppetMistress took a deep breath and thought long and hard about where the five rings were located. “Well... Ashley was in possession of the red one... until they escaped. They used the ring to escape, and it fell into the rift once it was used, it’s somewhere in that other universe...” PuppetMistress scratched her chin. “The Blue One is kept in a collection, by Monica Costello, A.K.A. Nightshade...” A shiver was sent up Jake’s spine. The massive businesswoman who wanted nothing more than to make Jake her bitch had one of these rings, meaning that Jake would probably have to come into prolixity with her at some point to get it.

“The Yellow one, the gemstone was removed, actually. I believe Brooke has used it for the centerpiece in the championship belt for that wrestling promotion she won...”

Jake’s mind harkened back to the day that he saved Metropolis from a power hungry Japanese businesswoman, and several professional wrestlers, before it all just turned out to be a test to see if Brooke could revive that near-dead promotion. If Jake recalled, he had a claim to that championship belt. It may be as easy as walking in there and asking for it.

“The green one, rumor has it, has been being passed around on the black market as of late. Who knows what kind of shady character has it in their possession. And I’m afraid the black one has been lost to time. Even I don’t know where it is. But as long as it’s out there, they can get their hands on it. So we need to find it and destroy it.”

“Look, all of this is important, and all...” Courtney had heard enough of PuppetMistress trying to drag Jake back into his superhero life. “But why can’t you do this all yourself? You apparently were able to lock them away once before. Why aren’t you able to do it again?”

PuppetMistress raised an eyebrow, and sat back, folding her arms. “Maybe you weren’t listening when I said there was a rip in the lining of the universe. That’s where I locked them away the first time. For me to fix that rift, it’s gonna take a long time, and I’m gonna have to put all of my energy into it. By the time I do, they will have gotten all of the rings.” Courtney rolled her eyes once again. “Then why don’t you go and hunt down the rings and destroy them?” “Because I have to fix the rift in the universe, so we have someplace to put them before they destroy everything, you dense bitch!” Both women had stood up now, and were practically screaming in each other’s faces. Jake quickly stood up and got between them. “Girls! Girls! Knock it off. Breathe... I’ll go get the rings. I’ve dealt with all of those immortal bitches before. I’ll be fine.”

After talking his wives down, Jake thought long and hard about the task ahead of him. It had the possibility to be his most dangerous adventure yet. But this was still his city, and it was still his job to defend it.

Jake pressed a button on the desk, and one of the wall panels opened up, revealing a brand new Birdsuit. Blue and Chrome instead of the old blue and orange he once donned. PuppetMistress grinned, but Courtney was still visibly nervous.

“Time to save the world again, I suppose...”
1.title: Rise of the Immortals

11.content:
“.... I’m sorry, what?!” Beth said, whispering over coffee with Jake. If anybody around them had heard what was being talked about, it would send everybody into a panic. “The Immortals are back? And they’re trying to summon something called Filthmother? Fucking hell...” Beth slammed her fist lightly down on the table. “So much for being done with all the hero shit...” Beth sighed and leaned back. “So much for being free from all of the stink shit..” Jake’s lips pursed and he looked back up from his coffee. “So... does this mean that you’re in?”


Beth took a moment, and a long sip of coffee, before giving Jake a hesitant nod. “Yeah... yeah, I’m in.” Jake cracked a bit of a smile. There really was no way he’d be able to successfully get those rings without his old partner. “Great. I have a new catsuit prototype i’ve been working on for you. Stronger armor, better gadgets, a bunch of upgrades. Should make our jobs a little easier.” Beth nodded along with Jake’s explanation of the suit, before raising a concern of her own. “Well, that’s all well and good, but we’re still outnumbered to shit. Even with you, me, Courtney, and those two god friends of yours, we’re gonna need more firepower to take down the Immortals.”


Jake nodded in agreement. “Way ahead of you. I went ahead and gave Sting and Dart a ring, and they said they would be down to join us. They don’t wanna see anything named “Filthmother” around here either.” Jake used another mouthful of coffee in order to stall, taking the time to figure out how he was going to word what he was about to say next. “I also think we should... try to get one of the villains.” Beth’s face soured and her brow downshifted as she shook her head. “No. That’s a horrible idea. They’re just gonna get us killed... or worse.”

Jake sighed and bit his lip. “Look, Beth... I’ve been in constant contact with the prison, many of them have made leaps and bounds in the reform program. Some may even be up for parol soon. We could use their knowledge and power to level the playing field against the Immortals. Anything that gives us a better shot, we should be considering.”

Beth crossed her arms and sighed, sitting back in her chair. “You’d better be right about this... who did you have in mind anyways?”


Jake took a moment to think about it before speaking. “I was thinking we could try....
11.title: Jake goes and tells Beth what's going on

115.title: A different villain

choices: Jake goes straight for the sheriff's office
Jake needs a drink, he goes to the Crushed Weasel
Jake gets an invitation to meet the mayor from a shady rat
Jake witnesses Roxxie Roo thundering into town
12.content:
With a weary sigh Jake finished putting on his suit. It almost felt wrong to wear this again after years of peace, but if what PuppetMistress was saying proved to be even partially true, the city would soon have need of its heroes again. The first thing that drew his curiosity was the rift she had mentioned. A rip into reality that led to a different universe. He could only marvel at the possibilities. Perhaps it was the location of the ring she couldn't detect. Before he left his lair, Birdboy made sure to send a message to Beth, in case she was keen to investigate all this herself. He went to where PuppetMistress had told him the rift was. When he arrived he felt a wave of uncertainty wash over him.

Before the superhero stood a strange, swirling portal. It seemed almost alive, shuddering and resonating as he stepped closer. It stood no taller than 8 feet, hovering a little off the ground. The subtle glow didn't show him anything, but there was a strange, dusty smell emanating from the gateway. Birdboy cautiously stepped closer until he was stood within touching distance. As he reached out, the mysterious energy tried to reach out to him too. Before he made contact he pulled back his hand.

"Alright Jake, do it for the city. Do it for Courtney, PuppetMistress, for Beth and everyone else." He whispered to himself, steeling his resolve and taking the final steps into the unknown.

The journey through the gate was as quick as it was harrowing. His every sense was utterly distorted. He felt hot, cold, wet and dry all at the same time. His nose smelled every smell and his mouth was filled with every taste imaginable. Thankfully it only lasted a few seconds before throwing him into a surface of loose sand. The hero stood up, surveying his surroundings. He was in a narrow gorge, two towering red-brown rock walls on either side concealing the rift behind him. The fine sand was warm and the air felt dry. As he walked out from the gorge his initial suspicions were confirmed. Before him stretched a vast plain. A sea of sand with small patches of burnt grass and and hardy little bushes. The classic backdrop to so many of the westerns he'd seen growing up. The rugged landscape showed few signs of civilization, bar a post not too far from him. It stood on a road leading along the rocky hills behind him, a path splitting off and leading up into the hills.

"Gold Springs ->, Gold Hills <-" It read. Beneath it was a faded pamphlet, nailed to the post. It spoke of a saloon called the Crushed Weasel, with the best drinks for miles. With a relieved smile he read that this saloon, and by extent the town, were only about a mile away, probably hidden just behind these hills. If his mission to explore this strange reality was going to offer any success, meeting up with the locals seemed like a solid start. Just to be on the safe side he left a tracking beacon by the portal. He also took a moment to memorize his surroundings, should he ever need to get back to the portal in a hurry and not have access to his tech. He couldn't be too careful. Who only knew what mysteries this world still held.

After a short trek in the hot sun he saw the first buildings emerge from behind the hill. It looked like a town lifted straight from one of his westerns and he quickly approached. But as he drew near enough to see the first few citizens he realized something was off. More than a few of them seemed to have... odd colors. As he wandered closer he saw it wasn't just that. Their skin was covered in fur and their faces adorned with muzzles of all shapes and sizes. It dawned on him that every last person in this town was an anthro animal of some kind. As he reached the outer edge of town some of the townsfolk had spotted him too. They stared with disbelief at Birdboy, who began to feel a little awkward. He was no stranger to anthro animals, as more than a few of the supervillains he fought were part animal. But it quickly dawned on him that he might be the first human to step foot in this universe, and he was dressed up in a superhero suit to boot.

"Fear not citizens, I'm not here to hurt anyone." He said with his best heroic voice, but the strange looks didn't dissipate. One of the drunks stumbling out of the saloon glared at him, then back at his bottle, wondering if this odd hairless thing was just a figment of his imagination. Birdboy began to feel increasingly uncomfortable, but in all this there was one small relief. As he heard the citizens of Gold Springs whisper to eachother about him, he could discern that they at least spoke English. Of all the issues that might present itself, at least translation wouldn't be one.

"Howdy there, partner." A voice rang out. A red fox woman stepped closer, waving her hand. She was roughly the same size as him, with a bushy tail and a fiery red hairdo. Her curious eyebrow was raised high enough to nearly pop off her face and her hand hovered over the holster of her revolver.

"Hello." Jake politely replied. "Don't worry, I don't mean anyone any harm." He hastily added, easing her nerves somewhat.

"Ah'll say, ah ain't ever seen somethin like you walk into town. What's yer name, stranger?"

"I am Birdboy." He stammered, knowing how crazy it must sound.

"Bird... boy? You from the circus or somethin?"

"It's a long story." He sighed wearily. He was going to get this from a lot of people here, he could already tell.

"Well, ya should tell me sometime along with a drink. Name's April, April Briggs. Ah'm the deputy of the sheriff in these parts. Ya might've heard of her. The name Texas Stanton ring a bell?"

"Sorry, I'm not from around here, but if she's with local law enforcement I might have a few questions for her."

"Hah, and ah bet she's got more than a few for you too." April laughs. "Sheriff's office is down the street, ya can't miss it. And since yer new in town, lemme give you some quick advice. First, get yourself a weapon, 'cause walkin around unarmed is a good way to get robbed."

"Trust me, miss April, I'm well capable of defending myself." He replied confidently.

"If ya say so... Anyway, there's some folks ya wanna keep an eye out for around here. First's Georgia. She's a big ol' horse woman with a temper like a rabid wolverine. She's an old deputy of Texas that got kicked out, and she's still grumpy about that. Unless you're lookin to get squashed underneath her ass, steer clear of her." The hero sighed a little. Of all the things this place could have in common with his home town, why did it have to be evildoers that like to use their butt?

"Next is Vivian, the mayor. Don't trust her honeyed words. Not gonna say more, 'cause she got ears everywhere." Birdboy noticed a couple of individuals trying to stay unnoticed as they were listening in on the two of them. He just nodded, prompting April to continue.

"Lastly there's Roxxie Roo. She rolls into town every so often to try her luck at robbing someone. Do not get in her way. Bigger folk than you have tried and she's dragged them all off to her lair in the hills. Most o' them we never saw again. Ain't many fates more cruel than endin up as her plaything. There's also Smiling Jacks and her gang, but unless you're a cow or someone tryin to stop them from stealin cattle, you ain't gonna notice them."

"Is that all?" He asks, trying to hide his sarcasm. For having such a supposedly famous sheriff there sure was a lot of crime going around. He began to wonder why this Texas was so popular around here.

"Yeah, that about covers it, welcome to Gold Springs, Birdboy." April said with a small giggle as she tried to keep a straight face when saying his name. She gives the hero a mighty smack on his back before continuing on her way.
12.title: Jake goes to investigate that rift outside of town

choices: He tells her everything down to the smallest detail
He only tells what he feels she should know
He tells her nothing and tries to question her instead.
121.content:
Jake decides that if he was gonna get anywhere in this place, he needs help from the locals. Even if this "Texas" let so much crime happen on her watch, bad law enforcement is better than none at all. He makes his way down the street to where April said the sheriff's office was. His walk through town is met with just as many stares and whispered comments as when he entered.

Sure enough, at the end of the street was a building with the word "SHERIFF" in big bold letters on the front. Even a poor gambler could win this guessing game. Wanting to get off the street quick, Jake opens the door and walks in. Just inside, her sees April from before talking to a female... rat? gerbil? rodent?

"Swear to God Texas, he was some kind of hairless ape dressed up like a bird. He looked like one of them acrobat people at the circus. Had a name like one too. 'Birdboy' he called himself." She says with a chuckle.

"I see what you mean April." The rodent replies. When April gives her a look of confusion, she points the fox's attention to the door where the hero stood. "He came in while you were laughing about him." April realizes her mistake and backs off to let the two speak.

"So you're this sheriff Texas I heard so much about? I gotta say, I wasn't expecting you to be some kind of rodent." She looks angered by the hero's words.

"That's 'weasel' to you son, you'd best remember that. But I'm sure you're not here to split hairs and neither am I. Let's just get right down to brass tacks... Birdboy, was it?" He nods. "So, what are you? Where are you from? And most importantly, what are you doing here in Gold Springs?"

How does Jake respond?
121.title: Jake goes straight for the sheriff's office

1211.content:
"It's a long story. It might sound crazy, but I can guarantee you that all of what I'm about to tell you is true. You must believe me." Jake explains, pulling a chair up to Texas' desk.

"Son, right now I'm staring at some kind of hairless ape dressed up in an armored birdsuit that even circus folk would call too much. I'd say I'm in a very believing mood right now." She responds as she leans in to stare the hero in the eye. Jake, meanwhile, was a bit angered by her words.

"Let's start there. I'm not a 'hairless ape', I'm a human. If you don't want me calling you rodent, then you treat me with the same respect. Okay?" He asks.

"Fair enough. Sorry about that pardner, but nothing like you has ever been seen 'round these parts. So where you from?"

"That's where the weirdness starts. I'm from a completely different dimension, one where humans are the dominant species and anthropomorphic animals like you guys are usually a result of science gone wrong." The sheriff shares a confused look with her deputy before turning back to him.

"Okay... Putting aside this 'multiple dimensions' business for later. What exactly are you supposed to be in this world of yours then, some kind of circus performer? What's with the outfit?" April questions.

"In my world, I'm what's known as a super hero. I help the police put away criminals from the standard thug to super villains. The whole point of the costume is to keep the people of my world from knowing who I am so I'm not hounded by fans or targeted by my enemies."

"Alright. So you're some kind of vigilante. I can respect that I suppose. Already then, now on to the million dollar question. What are you doing here?" Texas asked.

"Strap yourselves in ladies. This is going to be a long one." Jake goes on to explain everything about the mission. The immortals, Puppetmistress, the rings, and finally, the Filthmother. "So that's everything I know." Jake wraps up.

"So you're out to save the multiverse from this Filthmother, and to do so, you need to find these magic rings before the immortals can, and give them to Puppetmistress so she can destroy them?" Texas recaps.

"That's right. Apparently, when the immortals escaped, the red ring they used fell into a dimensional rift, which coincidentally leads to your world. I need your help to track it down before they do." After hearing this, Texas sat in silence for several minutes, processing all this, before finally speaking again.

"Alright pardner, you've got my help. On two conditions." She says, standing up.

"Those being?"

"Number one, I'm coming with you even after you find the ring here. From the sound of it, you could use all the help you can get, and my world is in just as much trouble as yours. So if you want my help, then you're gettin' it all the way to the final showdown with these immortals. No macho man bravado about going alone." She explains.

"Sounds fine to me. What's the second term?" Jake asks.

"I want you to take off that mask and tell me your real name. I ain't about to go running around with some mystery man. You can put it back on right away and I'll keep calling you Birdboy in public, but if we're going to work together, then I need to know that there's a mutual trust here. Deal?"

Could Jake really reveal his secret identity to this woman he just met?
1211.title: He tells her everything down to the smallest de...

choices: Texas sends Birdboy to Penelope Rabbit
Texas deems Birdboy too dangerous. She arrests him!
1213.content:
"My business is my own. I don't intend to harm anyone, but if you get in my way I will not hesitate to neutralize you." He tried to be diplomatic with these creatures, but he couldn't afford to waste time. Instead he goes on the offensive, turning the interrogation onto the weasel.

"I'll be out of town before you know it. But for that I need to know where to go. Now, I was wondering if there's anyone around that's in tune with the... paranormal." Jake shivered a bit to use that word. But if anyone would know about a mysterious ring of power, it'd probably be some soothsayer or fortune teller. He saw the weasel's scowl worsen substantially. She had about as much disdain for that fake hocus pocus as he did, and his attitude probably didn't earn him any favors either.

"Now you listen here and you listen closely, little bird. I done asked you a question and until I am satisfied with your answer I'm well considering you too dangerous to let walk about. Folk around here don't take kindly to strange creatures threatening to 'neutralize' them. So unless you wanna try an' find your expert in my jail, I suggest you start telling me what I want to know."

Jake sighed with frustration. "I do not have time to waste on introductions. You wouldn't believe me anyway. For everyone's sanity, please just point me to the nearest fortune teller so I can leave you all in peace."

Texas buries her face in her hands, groaning with frustration. Was it really going to be one of these days? She didn't want this odd, hairless thing to walk about and accost the citizens of Gold Springs. But if he was speaking the truth, maybe it was good enough to just point him where he needed to go and leave it at that. She trusted the scrawny freak about as far as she could throw him.

Even if she were to agree, who should she send him to? The weasel briefly mulled over her options. Gold Springs was in no short supply of con men and other tricksters trying to part the more gullible citizens from their money. Maybe some of them could deal with this annoying brat. Two sprung to mind right away. Penelope Rabbit was a hypnotist of some skill. She given the bunny a stern warning after she'd hypnotized the owner of the bank to give her a large sum of money. Thankfully Texas was there to intervene before she could get away. Unfortunately the bank director loved the whole act and insisted the bunny not be accused of anything other than being real talented. Maybe she can convince this birdbrain to leave town before he gets himself in trouble.

On the other hand there was Abrajin, the strange witchdoctor that resided just outside town. Her wagon was stuffed with strange trinkets and using her so-called 'magic powers' she claimed to be able to help with just about anything. From premonitions to cures, she had it all. Curiously she didn't seem interested in money, freely giving her boons and blessings to those who asked. Though people claimed her tricks to be working, Texas remained apprehensive. If this creature was looking for someone to find a weird trinket of his own, she might well be able to help him.

What does the sheriff decide?
1213.title: He tells her nothing and tries to question her

choices: Jake attempts entry through a second story window, using a grappling hook
Jake tries ties to sneak in through the sewer system beneath the mansion
Jake attempts to distract the guards, and sneak in through a first floor door
Jake attempts to disguise himself as a guard to gain entry
Jake tries to gain entrance via the massive garage
13.content:
Jake decided that the first order of business should be to go directly after those rings. If he could gain access to just one of them, and give it to PuppetMistress to destroy before the Immortals could use it to summon Filthmother, it would be a huge weight off his shoulders. He’d then just have to figure out how he was going to lock the Immortals back up, but he could worry about that when the world wasn’t in danger of being destroyed by some sort of Eldritch Abomination. Jake decided that the blue ring would be the easiest to tackle right now. It was the only one that he knew of location of for sure. The red one was lost in some sort of parallel world, the yellow one was in some sort of championship belt, which he didn’t know the location of, and the green and black ones could be anywhere. Unfortunately, for Jake, this meant he’d be running into Monica Costello, A.K.A. Nightshade.


Nightshade was one of the few villains in Metropolis who wasn’t behind bars, and she herself was the CEO and Chairman of her own gigantic tech company, Costello Enterprises. The 6’8 Amazonian billionaire had her own obsession with the young Blackridge, and had created her own supersuit, to go along with her horrific brand of stench, in order to corral Birdboy, due to her suspicions that the hero and Jake were one in the same. No doubt, if Monica caught Jake anywhere near her private estate, she’d have a lethal dose of her disgusting breath, and a horrific buttcrushing session waiting for him.


Jake donned the suit, and later that night, set out to the Costello Estate. It wasn’t that far from Blackridge Manor, located in the upper-upper-upper scale part of the area surrounding Metropolis, where many of the Uber-rich were housed. Jake climbed the gate and quickly dove down into the hedges to survey the area. Any sort of capture would no doubt put him right into Nightshade’s gigantic, filthy hands. He had to be careful about this, and he had to find a way into that mansion...
13.title: Jake decides to go right after the blue ring, a...

choices: Nightshade’s Power Armor has a DNA scanner, his cover is quickly blown!
134.content:
Jake watched from the bushes as a guard made his patrol around the outer grounds, rifle in hand. Jake thought about knocking the guard out and taking his clothes, but he’d have to do it quick. There was no telling when the next guard would be around on patrol, and Jake needed to get inside of that house as soon as possible. As soon as the guard walked by the bushes, Jake grabbed him and pulled him into a sleeper hold, knocking the guard out quickly. Jake began to strip the guard, putting on his clothing. info.description:
(Special thanks to SquashedFlat for any and all of his orginal characters featured in this story.)

After a long drought of crime in Metropolis, the city had moved on to bigger and better things. Without having to worry about constant attacks from the disgusting villains, the city was able to invest more in its infastructure, it’s technology, and other programs for the overall wellfare of its citizens. Jake Blackridge and Beth Thompson had hung up their superhero garb, and set out to use their new free time to make the city a better place in ways that didn’t involve crime fighting.


Unfortunately, something went wrong. The Immortals, a conglomeration of villains older than time, and more powerful than imagination, escaped from the inter-dimensional prison they’d been locked in by PuppetMistress, and now look to collect the five Keys of the Cleansed, in order to unleash the horrible Harbinger of Filth, an eldritch abomination known only as Filthmother.

However, it seems that in escaping their prison, they seem to have opened a rift into another universe... one that leads to a small, desert town, known as Gold Springs, inhabited by one Sheriff Texas Stanton.

And introducing, for the first time...

Queen Froststench: Queen Froststench is an ancient and lonely entity, sister to the Stinkromancer. Tens of thousands of years old, this 7 foot tall goddess has resided in a great tower in Northern lands, after all this time only the surrounding villages revere her, but for good reason! She has complete power over the cold. A true goddess of entropy. She is gentle and sweet, yet rather cruel. She loves nothing more than keeping mortals at her side, in a constant frozen state where they can still serve her and never die. Her victims will spend eternity as her cockwarmer, forced to drink her breast milk and eat from her long, eternally unwashed feet! So far she has no intention of interloping in mortal affairs, but she wouldn't mind freezing the Earth into her domain either....

Pladaria: In the times of old where honour was defended by knights, there lived one know as "She of the Moss". A great and terrible knight wearing mossy green plate mail. All that would cross her path would be taken into "her domain", a place no one had seen...or escaped. Very little was known about her until she began assaulting and ransacking villages with her damned soldiers. It was said any who was afflicted by her curses would be a thrall to her mark, and be unable to talk to anyone, but her. The fiefdoms banded together to fight the monstrous knight, who faught without sword or mace, preferring to pick up her opponents with her gauntlets and crush them beneath her gigantic ass. Her breath, rotten as death itself, spread the curse. Another method she took was to spit in the wells of villages, contaminating any who drunk her saliva. For the worst of her enemies she reserved her slime, from either swampy ass or feet. They afflicted an additional effect, they would become unable to pass out! Eventually her corruption was cornered and banished beneath the earth to a distant land...America...she was buried alive, but despite dieing, her curse persisted and preserved her. When she reaches the fresh air she shall awaken...and continue her conquest!

Will our heroes will able to stop the Immortals? Or will Filthmother rise to destroy all?





Rules:

So, this interactive is to serve as a sequel to Smelly Super Villains, but also as a crossover between my own work, and the work of author SquashedFlat, and his popular story, “Adventures of Texas”. Any chapters like that in this story will be deleted. Repeat offenders will be banned.
